meta.description:
Now we need to determine 4 out of 5 workers to each complete one of the four tasks. Since each worker has different skill sets, the amount of time required for each worker to complete each task is also different. The time required for each worker to complete each task is shown in Table 5-2.
Table 5-2
\begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline Task Time Required & $A$ & $B$ & $C$ & $D$ \\
\hline Worker & & & & \\
\hline I & 9 & 4 & 3 & 7 \\
\hline II & 4 & 6 & 5 & 6 \\
\hline III & 5 & 4 & 7 & 5 \\
\hline IV & 7 & 5 & 2 & 3 \\
\hline V & 10 & 6 & 7 & 4 \\
\hline
\end{tabular}

Try to find a work assignment plan that minimizes the total working hours.

params.name: time
params.description: Time required for each worker to complete each task

vars.name: assign
vars.description: 1 if worker is assigned to task, 0 otherwise

objective.name: total_time
objective.expr: quicksum(time[w][t] * assign[w][t] for w in Workers for t in Tasks)

constraints.name: task_assignment_A
constraints.description: Exactly one worker is assigned to task A

constraints.name: task_assignment_B
constraints.description: Exactly one worker is assigned to task B

constraints.name: task_assignment_C
constraints.description: Exactly one worker is assigned to task C

constraints.name: task_assignment_D
constraints.description: Exactly one worker is assigned to task D

constraints.name: worker_limit
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(quicksum(assign[w][t] for t in Tasks) for w in Workers)
constraints.description: Only 4 workers are assigned in total
